div.a: New York City Marathon Called Off

div.div: The move is historic — the marathon has been held every year since 1970, including the race in 2001 held two months after the 9/11 terrorist attacks — but seemed inevitable as opposition to the marathon swelled.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TzHrjJ&via=Digg&text=New York City Marathon Called Off

div.div: 'I WANT TO LIVE IN DISNEY WORLD'

div.a: R.L. Stine Is A Disney Freak

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RwfAQu&via=Digg&text=R.L. Stine Is A Disney Freak

div.a: Does Sandy Mean We Should Have Fewer Nukes, Or More?

div.div: Sandy passed over a total of 34 reactors in states ranging from North Carolina to Vermont.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VHD0kc&via=Digg&text=Does Sandy Mean We Should Have Fewer Nukes, Or More?

div.a: Meet The Climate Change Denier Who Became The Voice Of Hurricane Sandy On Wikipedia

div.div: Ken Mampel, an unemployed, 56-year-old Floridian, is in large part the creator of the massive Hurricane Sandy Wikipedia page.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PLVvr6&via=Digg&text=Meet The Climate Change Denier Who Became The Voice Of Hurricane Sandy On Wikipedia

div.div: LETTERMAN HOLDS RIGHTS TO TOP 10 LISTS

div.a: Village Voice Sues Yelp Over 'Best Of' Lists

div.div: The latest in a long series of stupid trademark bullying lawsuits comes to us courtesy of The Village Voice.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RAOdl5&via=Digg&text=Village Voice Sues Yelp Over 'Best Of' Lists

div.div: This is one incredible list of films/movies. If Peter Weyland wanted David to learn about cinema while the crew of Prometheus was still in hyper sleep, he'd probably have him go down the IMDB Top 250.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QbfmQy&via=Digg&text=IMDB's Top 250 In 2 1/2 Minutes

div.div: CHECK'S IN THE MAIL, HE SWEARS

div.a: The Most Indebted Man In The World

div.div: He can earn million-dollar gains without anybody knowing. He can execute make-believe trades by sending fake emails from hacked computers. He doesn’t always lose money. But when he does, he loses more than $6 billion. He is… the most indebted man in the world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SxMlLA&via=Digg&text=The Most Indebted Man In The World

div.a: Why Great Sign Language Interpreters Are So Animated

div.div: Wendy Callis's "mesmerizing" work during Hurricane Sandy called attention to how facial and body movements are parts of grammar in the visual language.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SlafsT&via=Digg&text=Why Great Sign Language Interpreters Are So Animated

div.div: JACKIE CHILES ALMOST GOT HIS OWN SHOW

div.a: 10 Sitcom Spin-Offs That Almost Happened But Didn't

div.div: Some of the most successful shows of all-time have been spin-offs, but for every "Frasier," there's a show about Dr. Crane's bar bros Norm and Cliff that never made it to your screen.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UlDmMz&via=Digg&text=10 Sitcom Spin-Offs That Almost Happened But Didn't

div.a: Why Do They Put Umbrellas In Your Drink?

div.div: That pretty little umbrella in your bar drink might seem like a fruity thing for a macho guy to quickly throw away. A cheap, meaningless little decoration. But it once served a more meaningful purpose.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VjBhWS&via=Digg&text=Why Do They Put Umbrellas In Your Drink?

div.div: President Barack Obama has spent nearly all of his tenure with a net loss in jobs during his time in office. Now that has changed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QZk68K&via=Digg&text=Tallying President Obama’s Jobs Record

div.div: A RETURN FOR THOSE WHO DROPPED OUT
From Steve Jobs to "Mad Men," LSD is once again prevalent in popular culture.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Umx7rI&via=Digg&text=Tripping Makes A Comeback

div.a: Why Don't People Evacuate Before Storms?

div.div: Who are the people who ignored evacuation orders? Given such strong warnings and opportunities for shelter, what caused them to stay?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Slgxss&via=Digg&text=Why Don't People Evacuate Before Storms?

div.a: The Internet Saves A Same-Sex Wedding From Hurricane Sandy

div.div: When a hurricane’s all but washed out your friends’ hopes of getting married, turning to the Internet can solve their problems.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X3XkRV&via=Digg&text=The Internet Saves A Same-Sex Wedding From Hurricane Sandy

div.a: This Dead-Simple Idea Could Fix iPad’s Lousy Typing

div.div: It’s hard to write elegantly on the iPad. Heck, it’s hard just to type a proper curse word without autocorrect getting in the way. But what if it could be different?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/L5Ze9T&via=Digg&text=This Dead-Simple Idea Could Fix iPad’s Lousy Typing

div.div: Wired’s editor in chief Chris Anderson announced today that he leaving the magazine to concentrate on 3D Robotics, a company he cofounded that makes DIY Drones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TzuaHF&via=Digg&text=Chris Anderson Is Leaving 'Wired'

div.div: If there’s one dream that unites all bookish folks (aside from, you know, universal literacy) it’s the dream of having a secret passageway hidden behind a bookcase.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VI11Yr&via=Digg&text=10 Kick-Ass Secret Passage Bookshelves

div.a: Virginia Man Owes $1.5 million For Sharing 10 Porn Films

div.div: Man ignores summons for P2P case, so judge socks him with maximum penalty.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RAAJWi&via=Digg&text=Virginia Man Owes $1.5 million For Sharing 10 Porn Films

div.a: The Wearable Campaign: Clothing Throughout The Elections

div.div: Usually, campaign duds mean the requisite campaign T-shirt, button, baseball cap—or mask, if you really want to make your point. But occasionally, campaign-wear turns more creative.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RxCF3Y&via=Digg&text=The Wearable Campaign: Clothing Throughout The Elections

div.a: Deadly Polish Plane Crash Still Mired In Mystery

div.div: The disaster that killed the Polish president along with scores of other dignitaries two years ago is once more a subject of fervent speculation—and political strife.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yc9wiF&via=Digg&text=Deadly Polish Plane Crash Still Mired In Mystery

div.a: Emoji Apps Are Getting Kicked Out Of The Apple App Store

div.div: Can’t say it’s a huge loss, but it looks like Apple is finally going to starting removing apps whose sole purpose is to offer emoji, the emoticons popular with the younger text messaging crowd.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tz90tj&via=Digg&text=Emoji Apps Are Getting Kicked Out Of The Apple App Store
